data.meta_description: Posts about Jeffrey Dean Morgan written by Lindsay Warren
data.text:
Tag Archives: Jeffrey Dean Morgan

Celebrating my favorite TV showâ€¦one more time! (Part Two)

Continuing on with my weekend of fun!

After Damon Runyanâ€™s panel on Saturday, there was a nice break to enjoy some lunch. I not only got a lunch break, but I had the pleasure of seeing my dear friend Kathy, who lives very close to the Sheraton where the convention took placeâ€¦and her new, little bundle of joy, Brayden! It was a fantastic way to break up the day and catch up with a friend!

Misha Collins (â€œCastielâ€) was the next guest to grace us with his presence on stage! This guy is hardly EVER serious on stage, so I knew we were in for many laughs.

The laughs started immediately when Misha very openly admitted to being the brunt of a prank on-set. â€œJared fondled my balls.â€ (Keeping it classy, as always.)

As far as paybacks go, his exact words, â€œI am not allowed to fuck up Jared!â€

If he could spend one day with any one actor from Supernatural, who would he spend it with and what would they do? It would be Amy Gumerick and they would â€œcrochet.â€ Yes, he was suggesting otherwise!

He did tell one story that was somewhat serious. When they were shooting the first episode of season 7, Misha was REALLY ill with some sort of stomach virus. He was vomiting A LOT and Jensen came to his rescue and made production shut down when Misha could not do much more for the night. (What a good egg!)

Misha noted that he wanted â€œMishaâ€ in the meta episode â€œThe French Mistakeâ€ to be â€˜more of a douche bag,â€™ as a big joke about himself. He said, â€œI wanted to douche up my hairâ€¦like on The Vampire Diaries!â€ (Snort!!!!)

One of the last things he said during his panel was, â€œI sincerely hope Cas is revived at some point.â€ We sincerely do too, Misha.

The other big event for Saturday was the evening dessert party, which apparently was renamed the cocktail party because there were no desserts this time. This was indeed a massive bummer for a pregnant chick who a) canâ€™t drink and b) was looking for at least a little treat that she didnâ€™t have to feel guilty for eating (like she would if she was not preggers).

Anyway, I of course did not take notes during this party, but I did take some pictures of the really creative centerpieces fans made. The highlight of this party was not only the bit of face time the celebs gave every table of attendees, but was also the judging of the centerpieces by the celebrities, including hilarious commentary from them!

A few picturesâ€¦

Sunday morning arrived quickly and with much anticipation! Sunday is when we all got to see Jensen Ackles and Jared Padalecki, the stars of the show!

Despite being exhausted and on west coast time, they were in rare form. I didnâ€™t take a ton of notes (Hey, I was smitten!) but here some highlights:

Jensen and Jared both would love to do a Supernatural movie! One major reason â€“ it could be rated R, and they could do/say things that they cannot on TV!

Jaredâ€™s least favorite â€œSamâ€ hair is when it is, as he said, â€œcoiffed.â€ He wanted to cut his hair so badly at one point, but Eric Kripke told him, â€œThis isnâ€™t Felicity!â€

Jared tweeted about this recently, but he got into more detail about his, as he called it, â€œfan girl moment,â€ when meeting the guitar player for Pearl Jam, Mike McCready. He said he was so nervous that he was squeezing his wifeâ€™s hand and was acting so over the top that Jensen had to leave the backstage area because he was so embarrassed for Jared!

Jensen said the best directing advice he ever received was from Kim Manners and it was simply, â€œHomework, homework, homework.â€ ğŸ™‚

As for what happened at the end of the 3rd episode of Supernatural this season, both Jensen and Jared liked the plot. They said it was â€œkind of a mercy kill.â€

The next event I attended was easily the highlight of the convention for me, a â€œDeanâ€ girl. 19 other fans and I participated in a 30-minute Q&A session with Jensen Ackles. It was REALLY cool to interact with him that way. It was very formal, but awesome nonetheless.

A fan asked about what, if any, props from any of his TV or movie projects was he able to take with him. He had to think about it for a moment, but recalled that he has a pick axe handle from My Bloody Valentine, books and other items from Bobbyâ€™s house on Supernaturalâ€¦and he plead the 5th on wardrobe pieces! ğŸ˜‰

Next, he talked about directing in Season 6 and Season 7 and how the two episodesâ€™ experiences were different. Jensen said, â€œWeekend at Bobbyâ€™s was kind of a day in the life. I could set the cameras and let the actors play.â€ But â€œThe Girl Next Doorâ€ was much more difficult because he acting in so much more of that episode. He added, â€œThis episode technically was a little more difficultâ€ as well, with the inclusion of the flashbacks.

He was bummed about a couple of big edits that took place in post production this season. One was a fun montage scene of Dean in the cabin, where he was drinking beer and sword fighting with one of his crutches. It was cut simply for time.

Another big shot that was cut was at the end of the latest episode. He told us that there actually WAS a shot of the â€œhotâ€ cheese (which was actually just vanilla yogurt with food coloring in it) being poured on the victim! Can you imagine? We actually said we preferred the scene the way it was shot, with the image being created in our imaginations only!

He added that â€œPsychologically, directing AND acting was a nightmareâ€ and â€œThere is a sense of calm when Iâ€™m acting.â€

Jensen explained that there were several times where he knew heâ€™d require extra takes to fully get back into character. He did say that flipping back and forth between being a director and being an actor got easier as filming progressed. Heâ€™s so talented!

Another part of directing that he truly enjoyed was working with the kids in â€œThe Girl Next Doorâ€ because the actors were really pliable and liked taking suggestions from him.

A fan asked a really fun question for us, but proved to be a harder one for him! What are 5 things we donâ€™t know about Jensen?

He hates being late. (I can relate â€“ Iâ€™ve had nightmares about being late for everything from work to concerts! Ugh!)

He is thankful for his patience, as he often finds himself staring at the front door of his house waiting for his wife Danneel to finish getting ready.

He sometimes will tell a white lie to keep Danneel running on time for dinner reservations! LOL.

He sleeps on the right side of his bed in Vancouver and the left side in LA.

He has not used a straight razor since the beginning of Supernatural and Danneel actually prefers him with a beard. He does as well, since when he is shaved, he feels less like â€œJensenâ€ and more like â€œDean.â€

Bonus fact that we found out at the end of the Q&A â€“ his wife has good taste! She bought him a gorgeous Panerei watch as his wedding gift. (Iâ€™m pretty sure my hubby has the same exact watch.)

As for Dean and Samâ€™s Season 7 arc, Jensen said, â€œDean is trusting of Sam. He understands Sam is dealing with a very unique situation.

And one minor spoiler â€“ look away now spoilerphobes â€“ there will be one episode with â€œEvil Deanâ€ and â€œEvil Samâ€ in season 7. Sounds like fun to me!

And the moment EVERY attendee was waiting for was next â€“ J&J on stage together!

The first thing these nice boys said was to the first-time convention attendees: â€œWelcome to the Supernatural family!â€ So sweet.

They were asked about pet peeves and they mentioned rude people on planes. Jared grossed us all out with talk of a man who was coughing up â€œloogiesâ€ but not spitting them out. â€œWhere did they GO?â€ he asked!

They both hope that Jeffrey Dean Morgan comes back for at least the series finale.

Jared gave both A Dogâ€™s Life Rescue and Doctors Without Borders a shout out. He talked about he liked being able to use his celebrity status to do something good. (Love that boy.)

Jensen told us that he currently does not own a car. He joked about the only car he drives is the Impala!

Jared would love to have a Supernatural episode that is modeled after The Twilight Zone.

As for fears? Jared does not like bears and Jensen does not like snakes.

A fan asked if they had ever read a script and asked themselves how they could mentally/physically shoot an episode. â€œAll the time!â€ they exclaimed. The further explained that during â€œThe French Mistakeâ€ they tried not to break from being â€œSamâ€ and â€œDean,â€ even when they were â€œJensenâ€ and â€œJared.â€

Another fan asked about which scene in all 7 seasons of Supernatural was the hardest to shoot. Jaredâ€™s answer? The original Lucifer in a white suit scene. Jensen? â€œAll of season 4!â€

When asked about one of their favorite moments over all the years of filming, Jared talked about a special moment at the end of season one that illustrates how close of friends these guys have been since the start of the show. He talked about how at the end of filming season one, they did not know if the show was being renewed. After they wrapped on the final day of filming, he fondly remembered just hanging out with Jensen and Jeffrey Dean Morgan in the Impala with some beers. Jared described the final day of filming each season as â€˜magical.â€™ Jensen agreed. He said the greatest moments are the ones off-camera, like pranks, etc. So awesome for two guys who work so damn hard.

Another sweet moment during their panel was when Jensen and Jared were asked how they were similar to the characters they play. Jared responded, â€œWe both care a lot about our family.â€ ğŸ™‚

And finally, congratulations to the guys on raising $3,500 for Once Upon A Cure by auctioning off a unique set piece!

Wait!! Hold on for the ride and donâ€™t go anywhere! Just because Iâ€™ve covered Jensen and Jaredâ€™s appearances does not mean Iâ€™m done just yet! We have two panels left to cover!

Richard Speight, Jr. was back for a solo panel on stage! Heâ€™s easily a fan favorite and deserved a little extra time with convention attendees.

He started out with, â€œHappy (Canadian) Thanksgiving! What a better way to bond with your family than to go to a Supernatural convention! (Hilarious right from the get go!)

Another memorable quote from Richard was: â€œChanging Channelsâ€ was probably my favorite episode of television Iâ€™ve ever filmed!â€ (Awesome.)

I cannot leave out this memorable quote, â€œIf there were ever a musical episode of Supernatural, Michael and Gabriel would do a karaoke duet!â€ (Can you imagine?!)

When asked who heâ€™d most like to be stuck in an elevator with, he stated that Katherine Boecher (â€œLilithâ€) was his preference. â€œShe seems crazy fun.â€ Then he changed his mind. â€œJared â€“ he could just take his hand and pop the thing open!â€

One of his absolute favorite episodes of Supernatural (that heâ€™s not in) is â€œSwan Song.â€ (Excellent choice.)

Check out his new movie called â€œThree Blind Saints.â€ It is coming out in November. He said itâ€™s family-friendly / squeaky-clean, but heâ€™s the lead!

His characterâ€™s name in the film? â€œSam!â€

Lastly, of course heâ€™d love to see â€œThe Tricksterâ€ come back!

Julian Richings (â€œDeathâ€) was the last, but not least, guest of the Supernatural convention.

He was yet another actor who was attending a convention for the very first time. He seemed genuinely excited and honored to be a part of the event.

He was born in England but lives in Toronto, where his wife is from.

He comes from a theatre background.

Julian stated the hardest Supernatural scene to shoot was actually the first one he shot. It was the scene where Death was eating pizza with Dean. He quickly realized that he ate too much too fast, and with so many shots to get, he needed to slow down!

His favorite scene was the opening scene he was in â€“ the introduction of â€œDeathâ€ to the song â€œOh Death.â€ Julian stated, â€œThose creative choices make the series so much better than so many others. (Well-said, Julian. Itâ€™s SUCH a haunting scene and yes, this show is THE BEST!)

Speaking of junk food, a few of his favorites are Mars Bars, Poutine and Butter Tarts.

He complimented the Supernatural writers as well as Jensen. â€œHeâ€™s so generous as an actor.â€

Check him out in â€œWrong Turn.â€

He does hope to be back on Supernatural.

He described â€œDeathâ€ as someone who is a bit misunderstood. He said, â€œI donâ€™t think heâ€™s just a scolding uncle. I think heâ€™s drawn to the brothers. I think he cares for them.â€

Other cool news: Julian is shooting the new Superman movie!

UK fans, you can catch him next at Asylum later this month.

OK, thatâ€™s it for me folks. I hope you got through all this and has as much fun reading as I did writing! ğŸ™‚
